document.title: Louisiana Student Standards K-12 English Language Arts

0A539BF728204E3490F910D08E44370B.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

1F1629A31DC24BA79BB463302C5CD47C.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

76F1E3DA30E44EF692EA658BD094D9F3.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

CF431941F8BE45B5936D8ADB30C9B094.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

221E49B2E0254C4284115D1373B319F8.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

6E224E7ECBBD47728C12FB87B6D76BC7.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

6297E6DDED544AB48A2AAA1BE0CC7DF9.description: With guidance and support, use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

EA824FD14B70475D873EEA83A766430B.description: With guidance and support, identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

3BF2A40231B541949887B4AA12F211E2.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

2FD6C75698584E46A6DBB9ED195F297D.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

665030E83EC1472D9F02505034DE3B98.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

FD83AB445E324C65A96F5FC83CD9D503.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

E7EF73D80E514940B0864BFE79C49469.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

7E09B74C0D3F4016BA5EE937D97305C2.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

5712D0212B4F4300BEA9F36BFE6E79BA.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

7CEC5F6E6DD84701B2BF86AC79A4BBF5.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

D48C2C4CDAAB42FFA2CB692477308704.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

B9388E289DCE493B9EECEC6CC630E8D3.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

6EA6D46160624A19B350DB60F6A32CCE.description: Print many upper- and lowercase letters.

3758B1DBC1704AFE888982E8692C8652.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

34812971E91A48DFB0EEF1F94C0121DF.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

2A7614BB23F44076B0A9D279B1D5C646.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

F367E171CC3546819610A46994A44D32.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

F7A0B3E4683A4A11AB9FB9F426D4550F.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

84EDFC78B12D4A0AA0C23FC81412A9D7.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

F3B5B184A12146E598FBFB37E8E0776B.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

F608430ECF23429C91B9F855DE1637A9.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

0F18A21B9BCE4DE3AA6E3BD37FAC662B.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

0F9E26D73C5B4A4FA52A975B8AF9B2CC.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

8E019702452B499D98730352D029B2E7.description: With guidance and support from adults, participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

2AA530E3CAB2410A80771D91DDCA61C2.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

4196F8BA90EE42EF9686F3A4C6E8CBF2.description: With guidance and support from adults and peers, explore a variety of digital tools in participating in a production of a published writing.

F9DD15A0662343F98C760C9A1267B907.description: With guidance and support, orally respond to questions and suggestions from adults and peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

8A387B162724454AB304D108E1D2D4A6.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

F9C16C372C4843419F2A42CE6746F9E2.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

5091D976959E4A42A08717862350F061.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is . . .).

6FB86E24913848D7AC584E5437E64BE1.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

A6F18942AEF844EAA6D855BCE6F91147.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

B664C264881C4F43973DEBC552A8CD82.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

9E64AD66E10A4891A416C12140CD862F.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

040761699BF64F17A5C2773EFFD6D79C.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

3DD849DB78D14C44B7BDDE52F6BE033E.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

78FBEFCBA3C2489AAF63BB0786C168E1.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

4320FDC1E24640FDBC6CE7E8AC7A35CE.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words.(This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

C8F7AD8D38134CCF8926D325BF37AB40.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

3D50BDE0A45845359B3AA7452D17CE83.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

5C68D227C4A14E5DB12470FEF39C0F4D.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

9C63D5A32FA54D1083CDAFBE3ADD77BA.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

1C6BF123E6384D19AD7A31634CF23020.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

D5E3E03B26B74FCABA90F810FC04962C.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

5E402E41DE1A45EAA1EC0D743B03FDEA.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

0DDF838467214298B8139E752266090B.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

A400016161F745ACB1FF05D3E9DB4EEC.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

E55B5A6751F2487FAA6AE68C2EA4E8A8.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

48E6592C5F2449C4A1EB1A8BBA821C55.description: With prompting and support, identify similarities and differences between two texts on the same topic.

BC5A2B1ABA07494CAF9BE23494695844.description: With prompting and support, identify the reason(s) an author gives to support point(s) in a text.

95D24833C7B2451982DA41F97C72BB49.description: With prompting and support, make connections between the illustrations and the text.

26D6BD2A77E0443D94210FDDD8EC92C4.description: With prompting and support, define the role of the author and the illustrator of a text and present the ideas or information in a text.

5C4FF39CCEDB4D70901C4C81E5C0DFAA.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

7C8B4F51558B45D7993BC96EB0DCD8BA.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

3A0AAAFD1B8E446585F2F9F49CBEFFE9.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

962CCDF70DBE4D3BBFF88766D353ACD2.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

2C82A1B732CF45E6B24A86E6996E1948.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

1A058F4C9B3A44A49E96DBF92D00146E.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

99AADA998ED04C3996CFF90939540DCE.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

3CC57FE535CB42EFAB35619CFC00527D.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

FD9BD890CC8F4E71B7EBD1B034272B4C.description: With prompting and support, make connections between the illustrations in the story and the text.

59F5772448CA465D806C739D1811C980.description: With prompting and support, define the role of the author and the illustrator of a story in telling the story.

E43B761668884E45BAE33E5B4138BB05.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

8295B8A1465F4AA89FDB1664E02F533C.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

9BEF099280EE4F8393CF62F72A7224D7.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

160877C7CED24BE7A7DA95CE49974C3D.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

D1EB569264D6445BA1BBA4245B1A13FF.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
